result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin D Curtis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt. Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent, which may include the Barron County Treatment Court. Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Court grants 4 days credit if revoked from probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin D Curtis

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
3:31 PM Defendant Justin D Curtis in court, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond appeared by video for Justin D Curtis.  Attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for State of Wisconsin. 
THIS COVERS 22CF83 & 22CM145. 
State relates agreement. Victim rights have been complied with. 

22CF83 - Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty.  
22CM145 - Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

State requests PSI. Defense requests the PSI be waived. Court relates and accepts the waiver of the PSI. 
State makes argument on sentencing. Defense makes argument on sentencing. Defendant addresses the court. 
Court relates and orders: 

22CF83 - 
Sentence withheld - 3 years probation. 
Court grants 4 days credit if revoked. 
Court costs with 60 days to pay or payment plan. 
Must maintain absolute sobriety. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent, which may include the Barron County Treatment Court. 
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample. 


22CM145 - 
Sentence withheld - 1 year probation. 
Court grants 77 days credit if revoked. 
Court costs with 60 days to pay or payment plan. 
Must maintain absolute sobriety. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent, which may include the Barron County Treatment Court. 
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample. 

Voters rights provided to the defendant for signature. 
CC: BC JAIL
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

9:07 AM Defendant Justin D Curtis appeared by video, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond appeared by video for Justin D Curtis.
COVERS 22CF83 & 22CM145 

22CF83
Attorney Raymond waives readings and not guilty plea entered.
Next hearing may be by zoom.

22CM145
Track with 22CF83
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin D Curtis in court.  Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond appeared by video for Justin D Curtis. 
Attorney Raymond relates.  Formal reading of Complaint waived.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing  Court questions defendant. The Court finds waiver of preliminary hearing is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and binds over for trial. Arraignment date set and reminder note given in court.  Address and phone number confirmed.  Bond continues.
Arraignment scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Qualifies for public defender.  Address confirmed and phone number updated.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.
